attributes.action: Formally request the EU allow UK citizens to request EU citizenship after Brexit
attributes.background:
It is clear that only 36% of the UK population voted for Brexit despite the more publicised voter turnout of 51.89% leave voters

The EU would agree that 64% of UK citizens (quite possibly more now) would like to remain or at the least retain EU citizenship as they oppose solo UK citizenship

attributes.action: Statutory periodic vision screening for all drivers during their driving life
attributes.background: The UK regulations are amongst the weakest in Europe relying on self-regulation and reporting. Road safety should start with good vision and current procedures lack any medical rigour to substantiate visual fitness to drive increasing the potential for injury or death due to accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
WHO declared poor vision is one of the main risk factors for crashes.

A 2014 Brake study showed 1.5 million UK drivers have never had an eye test.

Visit www.drivingblind.org.uk to rally support.

attributes.action: Immediately Review the Pubs Code
attributes.background: After 12 years of campaigning, the Pubs Code came in to practice July 2016. It was meant regulate the pubs industry and curb some of the unfair practices carried out by pub owning businesses that negatively affect pub tenants and the wider pub industry. It is not working and urgently needs reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: The Government set a review date of July 2019 to assess the efficacy of The Pubs Code. The failure of the Code has been so catastrophic it is imperative that the Government step in early and strengthen the grey areas of the Code. The simple argument is that an adjudicator has no legal powers, so the cash-rich pub owning companies are simply taking all the significant rulings made by the Pubs Code Adjudicator to the High Court and having them overturned.

attributes.action: Stop Care Home abuse by making it mandatory for CCTV to be installed
attributes.background: There are a raft of reports and incidents where claims are made that elderly residents are being abused, both physically and mentally in care homes and nursing home facilities.  It must be made law for CCTV to be installed in ALL facilities to ensure the safety of both residents & carers alike.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.facebook.com/StopCareHomeAbuseNow/ and 
https://www.facebook.com/supportstowell/ have been established to gain support for and to discover more about cases of care home abuse, as well as getting the story from the other side of the carers - some of who have spoken out about abuse they have witnessed and sadly been silenced and removed from their positions/jobs. Additionally, some family members who have raised their concerns have been threatened & blocked from seeing their relatives.

attributes.action: Specialist provision for children/adults with Foetal Alcohol Spetrum Disorder
attributes.background: There are thousands of children in the UK who have been diagnosed with Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder. Most are being failed by the NHS system, as there are no specialist FASD teams providing proper care.  Many don't fulfil criteria for CAMHS/Paediatric services so have no ongoing care in place.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a hidden disability that leaves children & young people vulnerable.  The NHS are frequently at a loss to know how to support this condition, with many children & parents left to fend for themselves.  Holistic specialised team for FASD families are needed, with specialised interest in working together to provide therapies and behavioural plans, including psychology, OT, sleep, medical, SALT, trauma, attachment & neurobehavioral (on the lines of Nate Sheets in Oregan).

attributes.action: Low cost path to CITIZENSHIP for all EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status
attributes.background: The Windrush crisis has shown that it is critical to provide fair protection for any of the 3 million law abiding EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status who contribute so much who consider the UK their home and contribute so much to our communities and Britain as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: EU Citizens without British Citizenship make a large net contribution to the UK in economic terms ( https://eu-rope.ideasoneurope.eu/2017/10/30/eu-migrants-give-take/ ) and so many other ways. The Windrush Crisis has shown that there can be no confidence in the promises made by the UK government when it comes to the protection of their rights. It is therefore critical that a low cost and simple path to citizenship is given to EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status.

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to address animal abuse and prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: UK to refer Sri Lanka to ICC in March 2019
attributes.background: Refer Sri Lanka to International Criminal Court, if it continues to fail to implement its commitment made to the UNHRC Res. [A/HRC/RES/30/1] by March 2019; by agreeing to provide accountability and transitional justice.
attributes.additional_details: It has failed to implement the resolution and brazenly repudiated its commitments to the UNHRC and victims of the war, so far without consequence. In March 2018 UN Human Rights Commissioner Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein has also explicitly expressed his frustration, having lost faith in Sri Lanka’s willingness to engineer transitional justice and has called on member states to “explore other avenues, including the application of universal jurisdiction,that could foster accountability.” the UN Deputy for Human Rights, Kate Gilmore called for the establishment of a Special Court.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background: Our government is not able to make decisions based on the will of the people because it has to get backing and approval from the House of Lords, an unelected chamber that does not reflect the will of the people. True democracy means that we should be able to vote for all members of parliament.

attributes.action: Prime Minister to establish Windrush Day as a national day celebrating migration
attributes.background: Britain has been an island for over eight millennia, and over this period many have travelled here to make it their home. The arrival of the MV Empire Windrush on 22nd June 1948 heralded the first known mass migration to this island and marked a step change in the story of migration to Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
22nd June each year should be recognised as Windrush Day - a National Day of commemoration and celebration of migration and migrant communities in Britain.The Windrush Generation are part of the public memory of British history and achievement and thus should never be treated as criminals or easy targets as part of the current hostile immigration environment.

www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/may/09/windrush-shaped-britain-70-years-immigration-national-holiday

attributes.action: Once the Brexit process is finished give the public the final say on the deal
attributes.background: Once the process is all finished give the public the final say on it give them three simple choices: take the deal, meaning we leave with that deal; reject the deal and leave with no deal; or reject the deal and stay in EU.

attributes.action: Legislation ensuring airlines must seat vulnerable people with their guardians
attributes.background: When booking a flight it should be guaranteed within the price that vulnerable people and young children are seated with their parent/guardian/carer and not exposed to risk of harm by separation on the plane. Protection of children is a right & not a privilege that can be purchased as an "add on"
attributes.additional_details: Airlines are exploiting a human right for vulnerable people to be protected by charging additional for seat allocation on a first come first served basis  and are avoiding responsibility for the safety of ALL passengers. Inevitably a vulnerable person will be abused, assaulted , bullied on an airline and the question asked will be "why were families or vulnerable separated". With modern booking systems there is no reason why seat allocation can't be made within the price in the first instance

attributes.action: Condemn the Faroe Islands for allowing the slaughter of endangered Cetaceans.
attributes.background: Every year, up to 1,000 migrating Pilot Whales and other dolphins are hunted and brutally killed in the Faroe Islands in a practice known as the ‘Grindadráp’ (or Grind). The cruel practice continues with the support of the Danish government, in conflict with their international legal obligations.
attributes.additional_details:
"An EU directive prohibits member states from all forms of deliberate disturbance, capture, or killing of cetaceans, however Sea Shepherd has evidence proving that Danish officials from the police, navy, and customs have been facilitating and even actively participating in the Grind." Sea Shepherd UK. 
We demand condemnation and ceasing of tourism and trade relations with the Faroe Islands until the Grind is ended in perpetuity. All evidence available to view on Sea Shepherd UK's Facebook page.

attributes.action: Leave the EU now
attributes.background:
The Government is not going to achieve a satisfactory outcome from its negotiations with the EU. 
We should walk away now. 
No Deal is better than a bad deal.

attributes.action: Routinely test pregnant women for infections such as Group B Strep and more.
attributes.background: October 2017 the devastating news no parents want to here “your daughters heartbeat has gone”. I was suffering with an infection and Sepsis, while showing no early symptoms no one could of known I was ill with an infection, until they did a swab whilst in labour.
attributes.additional_details:
During pregnancy infections can be deadly to both baby and the mother, if my infection was picked up sooner It possibly could of been prevented and antibiotics could of been provided.

Infections during pregnancy are common such as Staphylococcus aureus and Group B Streptococcus. The NHS don’t routinely swab for any infections. If I had been tested around my due date when I'd been given the option to have an examination my infection possibly could of been prevented and any other infections could of possibly been picked up. If an examination is being taken place then a swab could be conducted to pick up any possible infections and stop babies, mothers becoming ill and prevent these types of stillbirths.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to cap repayments on rent-to-own and doorstep lending
attributes.background: The Sun is calling for a cap on the total cost of rent-to-own loans and doorstep lending at double the original item price or loan amount. This was introduced for payday loans in 2015 and the numbers of people struggling with unmanageable debts to those lenders has more than halved.
attributes.additional_details:
People on the lowest incomes, living in the poorest places, are paying a poverty premium - around 7 million people have resorted to high-cost credit. People whose wages or benefits don't stretch far enough need to borrow from rent-to-own or doorstep lenders to help pay for things such as an unexpected bill or to furnish their homes. These come with exorbitant rates of interest - more than 1,500% in some cases of doorstep lending. 
It's time to stop the credit rip-off.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 Developers Demolishing the *Wet Woodland* area at Denham Country Park
attributes.background: Wet Woodland should be protected by law! The area is clearly wet woodland, but not being recognised as such. There are approximately 2000 different wild species in this area. Once these areas are gone, they are gone for good!!
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be No Net Loss of biodiversity in London. We and our future generations cannot afford to lose these areas which are important for air/water quality and for general mental wellbeing of those that use these spaces. 

The Mid-Colne Valley Site of Metropolitan Importance (SMI) for nature conservation is too important to be lost. Priority habitats and species must not be swept under the carpet.

Wet woodlands are UK most productive habitats equal to our rain forests there are not many left in London.

attributes.action: Amend the Wildlife Act so companies have to protect wildlife
attributes.background: There's nothing in the Wildlife Act which states that companies must put measures in place to prevent wildlife from being injured/killed whilst they are undertaking outdoor work. We want the Wildlife Act amended in order to reduce the number of animals going to rescues due to the work of businesses.
attributes.additional_details: The Wildlife Act needs to be updated in order to protect all wildlife. Companies have to take responsibility for their actions towards wildlife, for example, putting ramps down holes, covering up all holes, paying the bills of the animals they have injured and so on. By putting this in place, it will help reduce the number of injured or killed wild animals.

attributes.action: U.K. government to introduce National ID Cards to all legal citizens
attributes.background: The introduction of a U.K. national ID card has many benefits and few disadvantages. For example: it would improve security, reduce fraudulent claims to U.K. rights and benefits and make it more difficult to carry out other illegal activity. There are few possible reasons for valid objections.
attributes.additional_details: The principal objection to ID cards is that they are an infringement of citizen's right to remain anonymous. - this could easily be remedied by legislation under which circumstances an ID card could be requested I.e, voting, by police, claiming benefits or seeking employment. An ID scheme would also be hugely expensive. Estimated at £1 billion - but long term security and savings on crime makes this worthwhile. About 100 countries already have compulsory ID cards. Others have voluntary schemes.

attributes.action: Legalise medical cannabis for difficult to treat epilepsies in children.
attributes.background: Trials have taken place with medical cannabis on Dravet syndrome, the children on this trial have been able to continue to take sativex and this gives hope to other patients with refractory seizures. Sativex is available on special license for MS patients, please grant our children the same respect.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter Ruby had her first seizure at 5 days old, her epilepsy has remained uncontrolled ever since. Ruby’s seizures are life threatening, she has a very rare & complex neurological condition called AHC. Please grant leading paediatric neurologists special license to prescribe sativex in special cases. To save children’s lives, to give quality of life to my daughter & many others. Thank you. 

More information on AHC can be found by watching this short film:

www.humantimebombs.com

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into the 5g Health & Safety risks
attributes.background: There seems to be much proof of the dangers of Mobile Phone masts as it is, and now 5g is to be rolled out with a far greater percentage of phone masts on every street in order to facilitate it. This is, given the evidence so far, a grave risk to each and every person in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Devra Davis
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BwyDCHf5iCY
Brain Tumours Links to Mobile Phone Use
https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/39/3/675/631387
Italian Court Rules Mobile Phones Cause Cancer
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/apr/21/italian-court-rules-mobile-phone-use-caused-brain-tumour

attributes.action: Pass a law guaranteeing free speech except for incitement to violence
attributes.background: Free speech is the bedrock of western civilisation and should be protected from prosecution. People in the UK should be free to say what they want, when they want and where they want. This should cover all public places and places of employment. The only exception is an incitement to violence.
attributes.additional_details: People should be free to speak their mind at home, in a public space and in a place of employment or worship. Without free speech the evils of society can not be confronted and individual rights can be eroded by the interests of groups.

attributes.action: Ban Aspartame and its associated sweeteners from all food and drinks in the UK
attributes.background: The use of Aspartame and its associated sweeteners are increasingly being linked to many illnesses and medical conditions and even obesity.
attributes.additional_details: Many people use them because of obesity and/or diabetes or to help reduce their sugar and calorie intake. These chemically produced sweeteners are believed to be detrimental to the health and well-being of the population. There are natural alternatives that can be used in place of them.

attributes.action: Extend gender pay gap reporting rules to cover ethnicity pay gap
attributes.background: In April 2017, the government put into law a practice where employers with 250 or more employees must publish and report specific figures about their gender pay gap. We the undersigned call on the government to extend these reporting rules to ethnicity pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
Several companies and institutions have voluntarily published ethnicity pay gap data, which suggests ethnicity pay gap is as much of a problem as gender pay gap.

Tackling ethnicity pay gap is a national issue, and by making reporting on them mandatory, will, as with requirements to report gender pay gap, provide focus and momentum to enable positive change.

attributes.action: Declare the 2016 referendum on membership of the EU null and void.
attributes.background: Under section 3.3 (e) of the CODE OF GOOD PRACTICE ON REFERENDUMS the UK government should declare the result of the 2016 referendum null and void because of the decision by the Electoral Commission that rules on spending were broken and referral to the police has been made.

attributes.action: Scrap NHS surcharge for non EU living in UK who already pay N.I contributions
attributes.background: It has come to the notice of Association of Africans in Scotland (AAS), a charitable organisation that non EU families who legally live, work&pay taxes/N.I in the UK are asked to cough up an additional NHS surcharge (separate from the HO fees&other costs) when they renew their immigration documents
attributes.additional_details: Telegraph of 5 February 2018, reported Health minister saying: "Our NHS is always there when you need it, paid for by British taxpayers. These people, even though non-EU, pay taxes/NI as well which goes into the NHS. AAS believes in the United Kingdom as a country which champions fairness & subjecting applicants who already pay N.I to pay another mandatory NHS surcharge amounts to double taxation & therefore an unfair practice. AAS is therefore calling for a review and scrapping of this charge.

attributes.action: Fund seizure alarms for everyone with Epilepsy
attributes.background: I decided to start this petition after my son, 2 years old, got diagnosed with epilepsy and started to have nocturnal seizures. 1st December 2016 is when it all began with his first seizure - a 4 hour status seizure which resulted in him having to be placed into a coma on life support for 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) is when a person with epilepsy dies suddenly and prematurely, and no other cause of death is found. Around 1,200 people die from Epilepsy each year in the UK. Around half of these deaths are SUDEP (sudden unexpected death in epilepsy). If you have seizures during the night, having a seizure alarm that alerts someone if you have a seizure is a life changer. The Government must provide enough funding for everyone who needs one.

attributes.action: A final say on the deal negotiated with the EU, with the option to Remain
attributes.background: Leave 'won' the Referendum, but voters have not had the opportuniy of seeing what the alternatives to our current membership of the EU are, and of deciding whether the likely economic, political and social consequences mean that it would be better for the UK to remain full members.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was 'won' on a simple majority because it was said to be Advisory at the time. There was at the time no indication of the type of deal, or relationship, the UK would achieve with the 27 other members of the EU. The government later said it would respect the will of the people: but the people may well have voted differently had they known the result would be considered set in stone (mandatory referendum would require a supermajority.)

attributes.action: Reject plans to build a massive solar farm on Graveney Marshes in Kent.
attributes.background: Plans are being prepared by developers to build the largest solar farm in the UK on Graveney Marshes adjacent to a SSSI, nature reserve and the Saxon Shore Way. The proposal envisages unsightly 4 metre high solar panels on hundreds of acres of land which would ruin this idyllic area of coastal Kent.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is opposed by the local MP, Helen Whateley as well as Kent Wildlife Trust, the RSPB and the Council for the Protection of Rural England. Local residents are also totally opposed.

As a major national infrastructure project because of its' size, any formal planning application will have to be decided by the Secretary of State.

attributes.action: A call from the UK for UN Peace Keeping Force in Southern Cameroon at the UN
attributes.background: There is ongoing violence perpetrated by Government Forces and Southern Cameroonian militants in the English-Speaking part of Cameroon, specifically the North-West and South-West Regions. The UK needs to call for a UN peacekeeping force in Southern Cameroon.
attributes.additional_details: The English speaking part of Cameroon has for over 60 years since joining La Republique du Cameroun been subjected to marginalization and oppression of the Anglo-Saxon culture, which was considered untouchable during the unity of the two Regions to form the Federal Republic of Cameroon. There is the need for meaningful dialogue to resolve the crisis. Without an independent UN Observer to monitor peace and oversee dialogue, we could have a genocide on our hands.

attributes.action: Reject calls to add American Bulldogs to the dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Peta, an organization that is meant to dedicated to the protection of animals has called on the UK government that it should add American bulldogs to the dda, effectively banning them outright. Breed specific legislation is nout an effective solution. I suggest the law notices deed not breed

attributes.action: Regulate  open air prayer meetings of all denominations
attributes.background: There are now times when roads can be blocked by religious gatherings. This should not be permissible unless special dispensation has been sought and granted.
attributes.additional_details: The blocking of public thoroughfares, whether highways, footpaths or public parks, should be prohibited, except for special occasions when permission has been sought and granted. This should apply to all religions and the use of foreign language prayers (including Latin) should also be prohibited in a public space.

attributes.action: Legislate against anyone with EU pension serving in Commons or Lords.
attributes.background: I believe that EU pensions are a clear conflict of interest while leaving the EU. Legislate to make it illegal for anyone receiving or due to receive such a pension from serving in House of Commons or House of Lords.

attributes.action: Increase maintenance loans to students living in Oxford to London weighting
attributes.background: After being ranked the least affordable city in the UK to live, it would make sense that the government and student finance reflect this fact in the amount of maintenance loan students living in Oxford receive, but they do not. Rent and living costs in Oxford are well above the national average.
attributes.additional_details:
Studying and living in Oxford is financially straining on all students, affecting a students ability to achieve the best grades possible as they have to work long hours in a part time job just to live.

With the added pressure of part-time work, on top of an already strenuous University schedule, a students mental and physical health, alongside grades, can suffer.

The government need to assess the financial situation students within Oxford, as well as other expensive cities and fix the issue.

attributes.action: Annul the 2016 EU referendum result due to the overspend by Leave.EU.
attributes.background:
UK is a member of the Venice commission. The Venice commission's Code on referenda states (section 3.3 - Funding, Paragraph 24):

"In the event of a failure to abide by the statutory requirements, for instance if the cap on spending is exceeded by a significant margin, the vote must be annulled."
attributes.additional_details: Leave.EU have been found to have overspent spending limits by at least 10%. This is a clear violation of the Venice Commission and as a result, the Referendum result should be annulled and a new vote called.

attributes.action: Fund afamelanotide on the NHS to treat erythropoietic protoporphyria
attributes.background: Erythropoietic Protoporphyria is a life changing genetic condition, your body has a reaction when exposed to UV and visible light. You can't go out without covering head to toe, just to be able to leave the house. Inside all blinds must be closed, also lights to be checked. No prevention or cure.
attributes.additional_details:
Reactions mean weeks of agony. You feel like your blood is on fire, pain beyond words that no medication touches. Skin dries and cracks. You can’t talk, eat, and  struggle to drink. It can also lead to liver failure and Vitamin D and iron deficiencies. 
 
There is a treatment that works and other countries are using it but NICE has said no, because it’s too expensive. We are pleading for the government to fund this treatment and give EPP sufferers a chance of a normal life

attributes.action: Outdoor nature-based learning to be compulsory and weekly in all English schools
attributes.background: We believe that not enough children of all ages are being exposed to weekly outdoor sessions in all seasons and all weathers, connecting with nature and involved with sustainability, knowing practical ways to care and protect the world they live in
attributes.additional_details: This campaign is led by a forest school leader.

attributes.action:
Stop incineration of any waste which could be recycled. 
No new incinerators!
attributes.background: Incinerators are fuelled with domestic and commercial rubbish that has not had everything recyclable or biodegradable taken out e.g. food waste and plastics. We want 1. Legislation to stop waste of material resources. 2. Waste reduction, reuse and recycling to be made absolute top priority in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Incinerators (known as gasification, pyrolysis, EfW, ATT or ACT plants) produce air pollutants. These are a concern for public health: https://laqm.defra.gov.uk/assets/63091defraairqualityguide9web.pdf

A cross party Early Day motion signed by 19 MPs calls for a moratorium on incineration: https://www.parliament.uk/edm/2017-19/581

We ask that p.94 of this plan be put into law:    https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/673203/25-year-environment-plan.pdf):

attributes.action: Universal Credit: split payments between adults in each household
attributes.background: The UK Government pays Universal Credit to 1 account per household. Charities have expressed concern this could increase the risk of financial abuse. Payments should be paid to individuals to avoid enabling financial coercion and women being trapped in abusive relationships due to lack of money.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please see:
https://wbg.org.uk/analysis/briefing-papers/briefing-universal-credit-financial-abuse/
or
https://www.buzzfeed.com/emilyashton/this-mp-says-the-governments-own-welfare-system-is-trapping?utm_term=.sfdXrwbQN#.ggkXMWgGB

attributes.action: Debate a ‘National Strategy to Promote the Switch to Cloth Nappies.’
attributes.background: More families would switch to cloth with sufficient information and a financial incentive. Ringfence money so councils can effectively promote cloth through well resourced libraries, liaison with antenatal/ postnatal services and incentives. Hold manufacturers of disposable accountable to help fund.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK, app 8 million nappies are thrown daily; app 3% of our household waste* (app. half a million tons, annually)**. One baby will produce app. 1 ton of waste*** which takes > 200 years to biodegrade. Disposable nappies also have greater environmental costs due to the production process. Those who use cloth tend to switch to reuseable wipes and bags, further reducing use of single use items.
Councils pay £88.95 p/tonne, in landfill tax.
*Veolia ** recyclingexpert.co.uk
*** kickscount.org.uk

attributes.action: Provide free sanitary products to young women receiving free school meals
attributes.background: Recent media reports have highlighted issues relating to what is being described as period poverty. 137,700 UK girls miss school each year in addition to putting their health at risk trying to manage without these essential items. Cannock Soroptimists believe funding is needed to end period poverty.
attributes.additional_details: SI Cannock have established that this is both a local and national issue. The following links provide further information:- https://www.always.co.uk/en-gb/about-us/endperiodpoverty http://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-03-15/period-poverty-the-women-forced-to-choose-between-food-and-sanitary-products/ https://inews.co.uk/inews-lifestyle/women/period-poverty-girls-toilet-roll-afford-tampons/

attributes.action: Halt immediately UK arms sales to Turkey until they withdraw from Afrin Syria.
attributes.background:
Turkish aggression against the Kurds of Afrin is in breach of the UN charter and the UKs signitor responsibility to uphold the Charter.
It is acknowledged the vital support Kurdish Forces have given, in the fight against IS to the UK.A just settlement for the Kurds is a requirement of peace

attributes.action: Reduce the age of the meningitis Acwy vaccine to 3months
attributes.background: In November 2017 we lost our 10 month old daughter to meningitis W which is something no one gets a vaccine against until they are roughly 14. The only way to get this vaccine is to pay privately, which can cost about £200.
attributes.additional_details:
If this vaccine had been available maybe my little Lily would still be with all her family today. I don’t know what else to do other than try and look at getting the age reduced to try and prevent this happening to any other people. All please sign and share. There is probably plenty of other petitions going around for this but the more there is we stand more of a chance 
Thank you

attributes.action: Commission a statue of Enoch Powell to be placed outside Parliament
attributes.background: In light of the contribution made to the UK by his actions in Parliament and in the Armed Forces we urge that a stature of Enoch Powell is commissioned and placed outside Parliament to honour his dedication to his country.

attributes.action: Overturn a Home Office decision regarding a Kidney Donor who was refused a visa
attributes.background:
Gulfraz Ahmed, 33 of Luton is in need of a life saving kidney transplant.

Throughout his life he has suffered many serious health issues. By the age of 12 both his kidney's had deteriorated. His mother had provided a life saving kidney donor at the time, which has so far kept him going until now.
attributes.additional_details:
Gulfraz's only kidney has now deteriorated to the point he requires dialyses 3 times a week. This is costing the NHS £50,000 a year.

Gulfraz's family have found a match after extensive tests in Pakistan. All that is required is a 6 months visa to accommodate this transplant.

However the application has been refused by the Home Office.

We are seeking the Home Office to display compassion on the grounds to save a young successful business man's life. Sadly this is a matter of life or death.

attributes.action: Stop Postal Votes except for the elderly and disabled
attributes.background:
There is too much fraudulent use of Postal Votes.
Some people even sell theirs and this produces an unfair advantage. We must maintain a level playing field.

attributes.action: 16 and 17 year olds should be allowed to vote in any future Brexit referendum
attributes.background: Young people are affected more deeply than older people by the result of the Brexit referendum, as their lives will be changed for very many more years. However, young people aged 16 to 17 were not allowed to vote in the 2016 referendum, in contrast to the Scottish independence referendum of 2014.
attributes.additional_details: Are 16-17 year olds immature people, not to be trusted with serious political decisions? I don't think so. These days, teenagers are hounded with pressure to find work experience or summer courses during their holidays, even if they have only just finished their GCSEs.  When teenagers are forced to be hard-working adults so early, the least they deserve is to have some say over their future. If there is another referendum on any aspect of Brexit, teenagers aged 16-17 ought to have a voice.

attributes.action: Stop UK coastal crude oil pollution threat; ban Colter offshore oil rig.
attributes.background: The oil rig four miles off Bournemouth beach must be stopped and the Government should commit to a permanent ban on all offshore drilling in the area. Bournemouth, Poole and the wider coastal area is reliant on tourism and the natural beauty of the coast.
attributes.additional_details: A blowout could result in 20,000,000 gallons of leaked oil over thousands of square miles, devastating UK coasts, and their economies. Drilling offshore Bournemouth is a reckless gamble with our precious coastlines. It does not meet ALARP (as low as reasonably practicable) principles because there is an alternative - a nearby land-based extended reach drilling facility, where an oil spill could be contained and considerably reduced compared to a subsea leak directly into the sea.

attributes.action: Require political parties to have robust procedures for tackling discrimination
attributes.background: Traditionally, British political parties are regulated only by the electorate, apart from basic rules on matters such as campaign funding which are enforced by the Electoral Commission. There are no rules against discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
It is clear that political parties are not trusted to deal with discrimination themselves. For example, our polling has found that 92% of British Jews feel that UK political parties tolerate antisemitism.

The law should require political parties to have fair, efficient and transparent procedures for tackling discrimination amongst members, or the parties should face substantial fines.

Political parties should be obliged to meet a minimum requirement for tackling discrimination of all forms, including antisemitism, based on the Campaign Against Antisemitism’s guidance at https://antisemitism.uk/politics/manifesto.

attributes.action: Criminalise the export of cannabis
attributes.background: The government contradicts itself by telling the public that cannabis should not be legalised as it has no medicinal benefit however the United Kingdom is the biggest exporter of cannabis in the world. If it's illegal to sell on the streets it should be illegal to sell overseas.
